meanings.definition: To draw back or turn aside, as from fear or pain.
meanings.sent1: She would blench at the sight of spiders.
meanings.sent2: He tends to blench when confronted with loud noises.
meanings.sent3: The little dog would blench comically whenever someone sneezed.
meanings.sent4: His face would blench like a ghost when he heard the unexpected news.
meanings.sent5: The sudden clap of thunder made her blench in terror.

meanings.sent1: The brave knight did not blench in the face of danger.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but blench when the icy water touched her skin.
meanings.sent3: The comedian pretended to blench dramatically when the audience booed.
meanings.sent4: His determination made him blench at nothing in his path to success.
meanings.sent5: The intense stare of the teacher made the student blench with guilt.
